1.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to flee for protection; figuratively, to confide in
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to run after (usually with hostile intent; figuratively (of time) gone by)
to snatch away, whether in a good or a bad sense

2.brief: properly, removal; used only (in the construction) adverb as conjunction, lest
to pluck off or pull to pieces; causatively to supply with food (as in morsels)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
to break off or crunch; figuratively, to deliver
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
to snatch away, whether in a good or a bad sense

3.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
there is or are (or any other form of the verb to be, as may suit the connection)
the hollow hand or palm (so of the paw of an animal, of the sole, and even of the bowl of a dish or sling, the handle of a bolt, the leaves of a palm-tree); figuratively, power

4.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to treat a person (well or ill), i.e. benefit or requite; by implication (of toil), to ripen, i.e. (specifically) to wean
to be safe (in mind, body or estate); figuratively, to be (causatively, make) completed; by implication, to be friendly; by extension, to reciprocate (in various applications)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
to pull off; hence (intensively) to strip, (reflex.) to depart; by implication, to deliver, equip (for fight); present, strengthen
to cramp, literally or figuratively, transitive or intransitive

5.brief: to run after (usually with hostile intent; figuratively (of time) gone by)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
to tread upon (as a potter, in walking or abusively)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness
dust (as powdered or gray); hence, clay, earth, mud
to reside or permanently stay (literally or figuratively)

6.brief: to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
to cramp, literally or figuratively, transitive or intransitive
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style

7.brief: a stated assemblage (specifically, a concourse, or generally, a family or crowd)
to revolve, surround, or border; used in various applications, literally and figuratively
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
altitude, i.e. concretely (an elevated place), abstractly (elevation, figuratively (elation), or adverbially (aloft)
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again

a straight course, i.e. sail direct
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock

the right (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) equity or (figuratively) prosperity
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

'I pray', 'now', or 'then'; added mostly to verbs (in the Imperative or Future), or to interjections, occasionally to an adverb or conjunction
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
to test (especially metals); generally and figuratively, to investigate
a kidney (as an essential organ); figuratively, the mind (as the interior self)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

to judge, i.e. pronounce sentence (for or against); by implication, to vindicate or punish; by extenssion, to govern; passively, to litigate (literally or figuratively)
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
properly, to foam at the mouth, i.e. to be enraged
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement
properly, to hammer out (an edge), i.e. to sharpen
a bow, forshooting (hence, figuratively, strength) or the iris
to tread; by implication, to walk; also to string abow (by treading on it in bending)

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)

something prepared, i.e. any apparatus (as an implement, utensil, dress, vessel or weapon)
death (natural or violent); concretely, the dead, their place or state (hades); figuratively, pestilence, ruin
properly, a piercer, i.e. an arrow; by implication, a wound; figuratively, (of God) thunderbolt; the shaft of aspear
to do or make (systematically and habitually), especially to practise

strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol
to be (or become) pregnant, conceive (literally or figuratively)
toil, i.e. wearing effort; hence, worry, wheth. of body or mind
to bear young; causatively, to beget; medically, to act as midwife; specifically, to show lineage
an untruth; by implication, a sham (often adverbial)

15.brief: a pit hole (especially one used as a cistern or a prison)
properly, to dig; figuratively, to plot; generally, to bore or open
properly, to pry into; by implication, to delve, to explore
to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)
a pit (especially as a trap); figuratively, destruction
to do or make (systematically and habitually), especially to practise

toil, i.e. wearing effort; hence, worry, wheth. of body or mind
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the crown of the head (as the part most bowed)
violence; by implication, wrong; by meton. unjust gain

to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications)

Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
the right (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) equity or (figuratively) prosperity
play upon it; to make music, accompanied by the voice; hence to celebrate in song and music
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
an elevation, i.e. (adj.) lofty (compar.); as title, the Supreme
